meanings.definition: A person who shares the championship with another person or group.
meanings.sent1: The cochampion celebrated their victory together.
meanings.sent2: The two friends became cochampions in the competition.
meanings.sent3: At the end of the game, they were both declared cochampions, much to their surprise.
meanings.sent4: Being a cochampion felt like standing on the same podium of success.
meanings.sent5: The title of cochampion was a symbol of their teamwork and unity.

meanings.definition: To share the championship with another person or group.
meanings.sent1: They decided to cochampion the award and split the prize.
meanings.sent2: In the spirit of fairness, they agreed to cochampion the first place.
meanings.sent3: The athletes had to cochampion the trophy after a tie in the final round.
meanings.sent4: To cochampion the title, they had to work together as a team.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cochampion the victory was a display of sportsmanship.
